name: Viacom 18 (India)
description: Viacom18 Media Private Limited is an independent Indian media conglomerate, part of JioStar, and is owned by Reliance Industries and Bodhi Tree Systems. The organization operates various channels and content production studios in India. Following the merger of its assets with Disney Star, Viacom18 continues to be the largest shareholder in the newly formed entity. The company is involved in broadcast media production and distribution, targeting the media and entertainment industry.

name: Vimeo
description: Vimeo, Inc. is an American video hosting, sharing, and services provider founded in 2004 and headquartered in New York City. The company operates on a software as a service (SaaS) business model, focusing on delivering high-definition video across various devices. Vimeo provides tools for video creation, editing, and broadcasting, along with enterprise software solutions that facilitate connections between video professionals and their clients. Initially developed as a project by Jake Lodwick and Zach Klein under CollegeHumor, Vimeo has grown to serve approximately 260 million users, with around 1.6 million subscribers as of December 2021. The platform has undergone significant changes since its inception, including a controlling stake acquisition by IAC in 2006 and becoming a standalone public company in May 2021.

name: Verizon Communications
description: Verizon Communications Inc. is an American telecommunications company headquartered in New York City, recognized as the world's second-largest telecommunications company by revenue and the largest wireless carrier in the United States, with 146 million subscribers as of March 31, 2025. The company was established in 1983 as Bell Atlantic, emerging from the breakup of the Bell System, and initially operated in several states including Pennsylvania and New Jersey. Following a merger with NYNEX in 1997, Bell Atlantic relocated its headquarters to New York City, and in 2000, it acquired GTE, expanding its telecommunications reach across the country. The company rebranded as Verizon, a name derived from the Latin word "veritas" meaning truth and "horizon." In 2015, Verizon ventured into content ownership by acquiring AOL, followed by the acquisition of Yahoo! Inc. in 2017, leading to the formation of a new division initially named Oath Inc., which was later rebranded as Verizon Media in January 2019. The company leverages its immersive innovation lab facilities and advanced research infrastructure to test and validate solutions on its platforms.

name: UR (Swedish Educational Broadcasting Company)
description: The Swedish Educational Broadcasting Company (Swedish: Sveriges Utbildningsradio or Utbildningsradion; UR) is a public-service corporation that specializes in providing educational programming through radio and television. It is a member of the European Broadcasting Union and Nordvision, emphasizing its commitment to educational content and collaboration within the media landscape. UR's mission is to create programs that serve educational purposes, although specific details about its founding, headquarters, or employee count are not provided in the sources.

name: TVP (Telewizja Polska)
description: Telewizja Polska S.A. (TVP), also known as Polish Television, is a public service broadcaster in Poland, founded in 1952, and is recognized as the oldest and largest television network in the country. Following the 2015 parliamentary election, TVP increasingly aligned its programming with the right-wing populist Law and Justice (PiS) party, leading to criticisms from European media and the Polish opposition, which labeled it as a "propaganda arm" and "a factory of hate." In the wake of the 2023 parliamentary election, where the opposition party Civic Platform emerged victorious, the newly-appointed Minister of Culture initiated a restructuring of TVP, although bias against the opposition persisted. On December 27, 2023, due to a presidential veto on the company's financing, the Minister of Culture and National Heritage placed TVP in liquidation.

name: UPC
description: The Unified Patent Court (UPC) is a judicial body established to adjudicate matters related to the infringement and validity of Unitary Patents and classic European Patents. It comprises judges from all participating Member States of the European Union and became operational following the entry into force of the Agreement on a Unified Patent Court (UPCA) on June 1, 2023. Currently, the UPC serves eighteen EU Member States, providing a unified legal framework for patent disputes across these nations.

name: Viasat
description: Viasat, Inc. is an American communications company headquartered in Carlsbad, California, with operations extending across the United States and globally. The company specializes in providing high-speed satellite broadband services and secure networking systems, catering to both military and commercial markets. Viasat's offerings include various sectors such as aviation, enterprise, government, and maritime services, including partnerships with Inmarsat for maritime connectivity. The company is focused on unlocking opportunities worldwide by delivering connectivity solutions tailored to meet diverse needs.

name: VGTRK (All-Russia State Television and Radio Company)
description: VGTRK (All-Russia State Television and Radio Company) is a national state-owned broadcaster based in Moscow, Russia, founded in 1990. The company operates numerous television and radio channels, delivering content nationwide through a terrestrial transmitting network and regional production studios. As of December 2019, VGTRK broadcasts programs in 54 languages, including critically endangered languages such as Nganasan, reflecting its commitment to regional diversity. During the Russian invasion of Ukraine, VGTRK has faced accusations of disseminating propaganda and disinformation, primarily aimed at domestic audiences. One of its channels, RTR Planeta, was banned in Lithuania in 2015.

name: Viasat World
description: Viasat, Inc. is an American communications company headquartered in Carlsbad, California, with operations extending across the United States and globally. The company specializes in high-speed satellite broadband services and secure networking systems, catering to both military and commercial markets. With over 30 years of experience, Viasat has been at the forefront of innovations that aim to connect everyone and everything.

name: Videotron
description: Vidéotron is a Canadian integrated telecommunications company based in Québec, offering a diverse range of communication and entertainment products and services, including cable television, interactive multimedia development, video on demand, cable telephony, wireless communication, and Internet access. Owned by Quebecor, it primarily serves the regions of Quebec and Ottawa, as well as the Francophone communities of New Brunswick and parts of Eastern Ontario. As of Q2 2022, Vidéotron is the fifth-largest wireless carrier in Canada, boasting nearly 1,700,000 mobile subscribers. The company competes mainly with Bell Canada and Telus Communications.

name: UKTV
description: UKTV is a prominent media company based in the United Kingdom, known for its diverse range of television channels and programming. The company offers a variety of channels including U, U&DRAMA, U&W, U&YESTERDAY, U&eden, U&GOLD, and U&alibi, each catering to different genres such as drama, comedy, factual entertainment, and crime. UKTV's channels feature a mix of original content, classic series, and exclusive programming, with notable shows like "Call the Midwife," "Big Zuu's Big Eats," and "Murder, They Hope." The company provides its content through various platforms, including Sky, Virgin Media, Freeview, and on-demand services, primarily targeting audiences in the UK and Ireland. UKTV emphasizes free streaming options and is accessible via multiple devices, including smart TVs and mobile apps. The company is recognized for its commitment to delivering engaging entertainment and factual stories, appealing to a wide range of viewers.

name: Veon (Vimpelcom)
description: VEON Ltd. (formerly VimpelCom Ltd.), headquartered in Dubai, is a multinational telecommunications and digital services company that operates in six markets across Europe and Asia, including Bangladesh, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Ukraine, and Uzbekistan. As of 2024, VEON serves approximately 160 million customers, including 1.8 million fixed-line customers and 111 million monthly active users of its digital services. The company offers a range of services under various brands, such as Banglalink in Bangladesh, Jazz in Pakistan, and Kyivstar in Ukraine, with additional operations in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Uzbekistan under the Beeline brand. VEON's core mission is to provide connectivity and access to vital digital services, emphasizing the importance of communication and information access as essential humanitarian needs. The company's long-term growth strategy focuses on three pillars: Digital Operator, Ventures, and Infrastructure, leveraging a portfolio of digital services that includes fintech, education, healthcare, and entertainment. With a workforce of around 17,000 employees, VEON is committed to sustainability, diversity, and inclusion, fostering digital entrepreneurship and skills in the communities it serves. The company is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange and operates with a diverse shareholder base and a majority-independent Board of Directors.

name: Viaplay
description: Viaplay Group is the leading entertainment provider in the Nordic region, operating a Swedish video streaming service known as Viaplay. The platform engages millions of viewers daily with critically acclaimed content.

name: Viaplay Group
description: Viaplay Group AB, formerly known as Nordic Entertainment Group AB (NENT Group), is a Swedish media and entertainment company headquartered in Stockholm. Founded in 2018 as a spinoff from MTG, the company operates the video streaming service Viaplay, along with advertising-funded television and radio channels, and the studio production company Viaplay Studios. Viaplay Group made its debut as a publicly traded company on the Stockholm Stock Exchange on 28 March 2019. It is recognized as the leading entertainment provider in the Nordic region, engaging millions of viewers daily with critically acclaimed content.

name: ViacomCBS International Media Networks
description: ViacomCBS International Media Networks, now part of Paramount Global, oversees the operations of its television channels and online brands, originally founded as MTV Networks in 1984. The division has undergone several name changes, becoming Viacom Media Networks in 2011, ViacomCBS Domestic Media Networks in 2019, and finally adopting its current name in 2022. Paramount Media Networks manages its television assets through three main units: the MTV Entertainment Group, Showtime Networks, and the Nickelodeon Group, and also includes AwesomenessTV. The company delivers premium content and experiences to diverse audiences via television and streaming platforms, studio production, and consumer products. Its portfolio features iconic brands such as CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, and Pluto. Paramount's international assets are managed by Paramount International Networks.

name: TVRI (Televisi Republik Indonesia)
description: TVRI (Televisi Republik Indonesia) is the main national public television channel owned by LPP Televisi Republik Indonesia, which began broadcasting on 24 August 1962, making it the first television station in Indonesia. Initially, it was the only television channel in the country until 1989 when it started to share the airwaves with private television stations. TVRI is dedicated to promoting various values, cultures, and the diversity that Indonesia takes pride in through its quality programming. The channel is accessible via terrestrial, satellite, and most pay television providers across Indonesia, as well as through its streaming service, TVRI Klik. Prior to the digital switchover in 2022, TVRI operated with regional stations on analog broadcasts, except in the Special Capital Region of Jakarta and its surroundings.

name: Universal Pictures International
description: Universal Pictures International, officially known as Universal City Studios LLC, is an American film production and distribution company headquartered at the Universal Studios complex in Universal City, California. Founded in 1912 by Carl Laemmle and several partners, it is recognized as the oldest surviving film studio in the United States and one of the "Big Five" film studios globally. The studio is a subsidiary of NBCUniversal, which is owned by Comcast, and operates distribution and corporate offices in New York City. Universal Pictures is a member of the Motion Picture Association (MPA) and has produced several highly successful film franchises, including Fast & Furious, Jurassic Park, and Despicable Me. Notable films from its extensive library include Jaws and E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, both of which set box office records upon their release. The company employs over 10,001 individuals and plays a significant role in the entertainment industry.

name: United Media
description: United Media is the leading media company in Southeast Europe and serves as the media arm of United Group. It offers a diverse range of entertainment, sports, news, and award-winning original content, reaching a market of 40 million people across eight countries. The company provides a comprehensive suite of end-to-end media services, leveraging its expertise in media, advertising, distribution, and production to meet the varied demands of its customers and viewers.

name: ViacomCBS
description: Paramount Global (d/b/a Paramount) is an American multinational mass media and entertainment conglomerate headquartered at One Astor Plaza in Times Square, Midtown Manhattan. The company was formed on December 4, 2019, through the merger of CBS Corporation and Viacom, and it adopted its current name on February 16, 2022. Paramount delivers premium content and experiences to diverse audiences through various platforms, including television, streaming, studio production, and consumer products. Its main properties encompass Paramount Pictures Corporation, CBS Entertainment Group, BET Media Group, Paramount Media Networks—which includes cable networks such as MTV, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, and Showtime—and Paramount Streaming, which features Paramount+ and Pluto TV. The company also manages international versions of its pay TV networks and region-specific assets in countries like Argentina, Chile, the United Kingdom, and Australia. As of 2019, Paramount operates over 170 networks and reaches approximately 700 million subscribers across 180 countries.

name: ViacomCBS Networks Americas
description: ViacomCBS Networks Americas, operating under the brand Paramount, is a division of Paramount Global that manages its television channels and online brands. Originally founded as MTV Networks in 1984, it underwent several name changes, becoming Viacom Media Networks in 2011, ViacomCBS Domestic Media Networks in 2019, and finally adopting its current name in 2022. The division oversees three main units: the MTV Entertainment Group, Showtime Networks, and the Nickelodeon Group, along with AwesomenessTV. Paramount delivers premium content and experiences to diverse audiences through various platforms, including television, streaming, studio production, and consumer products. The company is headquartered in New York, New York, and employs over 10,001 individuals, positioning itself within the entertainment industry.
